alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Armstrong; Beaver; Butler; Clarion; Fayette; Forest; Greene; Lawrence; Mercer; Venango; Washington; Westmoreland (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 8:40AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN HARRISON... JEFFERSON...SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...NORTHEASTERN BELMONT... BEAVER...VENANGO...BUTLER...ALLEGHENY...NORTHERN GREENE...WESTERN ARMSTRONG...WESTERN CLARION...NORTHWESTERN FAYETTE...NORTHWESTERN FOREST...MERCER...WASHINGTON...LAWRENCE...WESTERN WESTMORELAND... OHIO...MARSHALL...BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 945 AM EDT... At 839 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking rain showers along a line extending from near Oakwood to 7 miles southeast of Cadiz. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Ross Township, Wheeling, McCandless Township, Monroeville, Cranberry, Moon Township, New Castle, and McMurray. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 214 and 225. Interstate 70 in West Virginia between mile markers 0 and 14. Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 49. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 1 and 66. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 12 and 137. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 6 and 57. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 4 and 84. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Allegheny; Armstrong; Beaver; Butler; Clarion; Fayette; Forest; Greene; Lawrence; Mercer; Venango; Washington; Westmoreland
